bill_title: establish fees for information provided from the statewide voter registration file.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to establish fees for information provided from the statewide voter registration file. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added: 12-4-37.1 Statewide voter registration file--Fees for electronic copies. The fees for obtaining a copy of an electronic file with voter registration information are as follows: (1) Statewide complete file, five hundred dollars; (2) Statewide complete file for new parties or parties with alternative political status for just their party voters: (a) Ten dollars for one thousand names or less; (b) Twenty-five dollars for one thousand one to ten thousand names, inclusive; (c) Fifty dollars for ten thousand one to twenty-five thousand names, inclusive; and (d) One hundred dollars for more than twenty-five thousand names; (3) Legislative district complete file, twenty-five dollars; (4) County or any other district complete file: (a) Five dollars for one thousand names or less; (b) Fifteen dollars for one thousand one to ten thousand names, inclusive; (c) Twenty-five dollars for ten thousand one to twenty-five thousand names, inclusive; and (d) Fifty dollars for more than twenty-five thousand names; (5) Any updated partial file that contains only changes made within a year after the purchase of a complete file: (a) Fifty dollars for a statewide partial file; and (b) Ten dollars for a legislative district, any other district, or county partial file. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added: 12-4-37.2 Statewide voter registration file--Fees for paper lists. The fees for obtaining a paper list with voter registration information are as follows: (1) Statewide complete list, one thousand five hundred dollars; (2) Statewide complete list for new parties or parties with alternative political status for just their party voters: (a) Ten dollars for one thousand names or less; (b) Thirty dollars for one thousand one to ten thousand names, inclusive; (c) One hundred dollars for ten thousand one to twenty-five thousand names, inclusive; and (d) Two hundred fifty dollars for more than twenty-five thousand names; (3) Legislative district complete list, seventy-five dollars; (4) County or any other district complete list: (a) Fifteen dollars for one thousand names or less; (b) Forty-five dollars for one thousand one to ten thousand names, inclusive; (c) Seventy-five dollars for ten thousand one to twenty-five thousand names, inclusive; and (d) One hundred fifty dollars for more than twenty-five thousand names; (5) Any updated partial list that contains only changes made within a year after the purchase of a complete list: (a) One hundred fifty dollars for a statewide partial list; and (b) Thirty dollars for a legislative district, any other district, or county partial list. Section 3. That a NEW SECTION be added: 12-4-37.3. Statewide voter registration file--Fees for absentee voter information. The fees for obtaining a copy of an electronic file with daily absentee voter registration information per election are as follows: (1) Statewide complete file, seven hundred fifty dollars; (2) Legislative district complete file, forty dollars; and (3) County complete file: (a) Fifteen dollars for one thousand names or less; (b) Twenty-five dollars for one thousand one to ten thousand names, inclusive; (c) Forty dollars for ten thousand one to twenty-five thousand names, inclusive; and (d) Seventy-five dollars for more than twenty-five thousand names. Section 4. That § 12-4-39 be AMENDED. 12-4-39. Promulgation of rules--Scope. The secretary of state may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 concerning: (1) Procedures for the establishing the statewide voter registration file; (2) Transmission of the voter registration information from the county to the Office of the Secretary of State; (3) Procedures for determining duplicate voter registration; and (4) Dissemination of the information from the statewide voter registration file; and (5) Establishment of fees for information provided from the statewide voter registration file.
